articles.headline: After the Battle, Fighting the Bottle at Home
articles.snippet: A body of evidence suggests that alcohol abuse is rising among veterans of combat in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.abstract: A body of evidence suggests that alcohol abuse is rising among veterans of combat in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: Most nights when Anthony Klecker, a former marine, finally slept, he found himself back on the battlefields of Iraq. He would awake in a panic, and struggle futilely to return to sleep.

articles.headline: Loan Pains Turned Site Into a Hit
articles.snippet: The Mortgage Lender Implode-O-Meter, a Web site, is gleefully tallying the number of lenders that run into trouble.
articles.abstract: The Mortgage Lender Implode-O-Meter, a Web site, is gleefully tallying the number of lenders that run into trouble.
articles.lead_paragraph: The misery in the housing market is registering on the Implode-O-Meter.

articles.headline: Psst! Hear the Rumor of the Day?
articles.snippet: Amid the desperation of the bear market, the art of the rumor has become increasingly powerful.
articles.abstract: Amid the desperation of the bear market, the art of the rumor has become increasingly powerful.
articles.lead_paragraph: “I will hurt the shorts, and that is my goal,” Richard S. Fuld Jr. fumed.

articles.headline: Europeans Reconsider Biofuel Goal
articles.snippet: European officials proposed scaling back drastically on their goal of increasing Europe’s use of biofuels, a major about-face on a central environmental and energy issue.
articles.abstract: European officials proposed scaling back drastically on their goal of increasing Europe’s use of biofuels, a major about-face on a central environmental and energy issue.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS  European officials proposed scaling back drastically on their goal of increasing Europe’s use of biofuels, a major about-face on a central environmental and energy issue.

articles.headline: Microsoft Is Icahn’s Ally in Pursuit of Yahoo
articles.snippet: Microsoft said on Monday that it was still interested in a deal, as long as Yahoo replaces its board.
articles.abstract: Microsoft said on Monday that it was still interested in a deal, as long as Yahoo replaces its board.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Carl C. Icahn, the activist investor, has a powerful new ally in his campaign to take control of Yahoo: Microsoft.

articles.headline: Bedeviled by the Churn, Sprint Tries to Win Back Disgruntled Customers
articles.snippet: Sprint’s new chief executive, Daniel R. Hesse, has much to do to repair the cellphone operator’s corporate culture and to stem the losses of customers to rivals.
articles.abstract: Sprint’s new chief executive, Daniel R. Hesse, has much to do to repair the cellphone operator’s corporate culture and to stem the losses of customers to rivals.
articles.lead_paragraph: OVERLAND PARK, Kan. — Sprint Nextel was in a crisis as Daniel R. Hesse took over the chief executive’s job last December.

articles.headline: Mortgage Fears Depress Shares at Two Agencies
articles.snippet: Shares in Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae fell sharply, reflecting a consensus among investors that the housing slump will be more severe than initially feared.
articles.abstract: Shares in Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae fell sharply, reflecting a consensus among investors that the housing slump will be more severe than initially feared.
articles.lead_paragraph: As home prices decline and Washington struggles to end the economic malaise, Wall Street is starting to send a sobering message: The worst is yet to come.

articles.headline: Washington Post Signals Shift With a New Editor
articles.snippet: The choice of Marcus W. Brauchli as the new top editor of The Washington Post represents a generational change.
articles.abstract: The choice of Marcus W. Brauchli as the new top editor of The Washington Post represents a generational change.
articles.lead_paragraph: Signaling a generational change at one of the nation’s most influential newspapers, the new publisher of The Washington Post on Monday selected an outsider as the paper’s top editor.

articles.headline: Fear for Colombian Hostages Still in Jungle
articles.snippet: The rescue of 15 hostages last week is threatening to eclipse concern for those who remain captive of the FARC.
articles.abstract: The rescue of 15 hostages last week is threatening to eclipse concern for those who remain captive of the FARC.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia  The nation is euphoric after intelligence agents rescued 15 hostages from the clutches of guerrillas last week, but for Magdalena Rivas, the outlook is not so bright.

articles.headline: Suicide Car Blast Kills 41 in Afghan Capital
articles.snippet: The attack at the gates of the Indian Embassy raised suspicions among Afghan officials that Pakistani operatives allied with the Taliban plotted the blast.
articles.abstract: The attack at the gates of the Indian Embassy raised suspicions among Afghan officials that Pakistani operatives allied with the Taliban plotted the blast.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan  A huge blast from a suicide car bomb at the gates of the Indian Embassy in Kabul killed 41 people and wounded more than 130 on Monday in the latest sign of a sharp deterioration in Afghanistan, where combat deaths have surpassed Iraq’s in the past two months.
articles.byline: By Abdul Waheed Wafa and Alan Cowell
